results.definition: act on verbally or in some form of artistic expression
examples: This book deals with incest
The course covered all of Western Civilization
The new book treats the history of China

results.definition: take into consideration for exemplifying purposes
examples: Take the case of China
Consider the following case

results.definition: take action with respect to (someone or something)
examples: How are we going to deal with this problem?
The teacher knew how to deal with these lazy students
We got by on just a gallon of gas
They made do on half a loaf of bread every day

results.definition: administer or bestow, as in small portions
examples: administer critical remarks to everyone present
dole out some money
shell out pocket money for the children
deal a blow to someone
the machine dispenses soft drinks

results.definition: do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood
examples: She deals in gold
The brothers sell shoes

results.definition: be in charge of, act on, or dispose of
examples: I can deal with this crew of workers
This blender can't handle nuts
She managed her parents' affairs after they got too old

results.definition: behave in a certain way towards others
examples: He deals fairly with his employees

results.definition: distribute cards to the players in a game
examples: Who's dealing?

results.definition: direct the course of; manage or control
examples: You cannot conduct business like this

results.definition: give out as one's portion or share
give (a specific card) to a player
examples: He dealt me the Queen of Spades
deal hashish
